bioghist.p: Margaret E. Towner (b. 1925) received her B.A. from Carleton College. In 1954 Towner received her B.D. degree from Union Theological Seminary. In 1956 she was ordained in the Cayuga-Syracuse Presbytery, the first woman to be ordained in the Presbyterian Church in the USA, and was enrolled as a member of the Presbytery of Lehigh. Before her ordination, she was a commissioned church worker in Allentown, Pennsylvania, serving as minister of Christian education at the First Presbyterian Church. After her ordination Towner went on to pastor churches in Maryland, Pennsylvania, Michigan, Indiana and Wisconsin. She took clinical pastoral training and served as chaplain in an Indianapolis hospital emergency room. She was moderator of the Milwaukee Presbytery, and ran for Moderator of the United Presbyterian Church General Assembly.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of papers of Margaret E. Towner related to her ordination in 1956. Materials include: programs; magazines and newspaper clippings; photographs from her ordination; and correspondence. The collection also includes several typescripts of sermons, exams from seminary, and congregation newsletters.
